function.name: to_tm
function.purpose: Function that creates a tm struct from a local_date_time.

method.name: has_dst
method.purpose: True if zone uses daylight savings adjustments.

method.name: dst_local_start_time
method.purpose: Local time that DST starts – NADT if has_dst is false.

method.name: dst_local_end_time
method.purpose: Local time that DST ends – NADT if has_dst is false.

method.name: base_utc_offset
method.purpose: Base offset from UTC for zone (eg: -07:30:00)

method.name: dst_offset
method.purpose: Adjustment forward or back made while DST is in effect.

method.name: to_posix_string
method.purpose: Returns a POSIX time_zone string for this object.

header.name: boost/date_time/local_time/date_duration_operators.hpp
header.para: Operators for local_date_time and optional gregorian types. Operators use snap-to-end-of-month behavior. Further details on this behavior can be found in reference for date_time/date_duration_types.hpp and documentation for month and year iterators.

description.para: Adds a months object and a local_date_time. Result will be same day-of-month as local_date_time unless original day was the last day of month. see date_time::months_duration for more details
Adds a months object to a local_date_time. Result will be same day-of-month as local_date_time unless original day was the last day of month. see date_time::months_duration for more details
Subtracts a months object and a local_date_time. Result will be same day-of-month as local_date_time unless original day was the last day of month. see date_time::months_duration for more details
Subtracts a months object from a local_date_time. Result will be same day-of-month as local_date_time unless original day was the last day of month. see date_time::months_duration for more details
Adds a years object and a local_date_time. Result will be same month and day-of-month as local_date_time unless original day was the last day of month. see date_time::years_duration for more details
Adds a years object to a local_date_time. Result will be same month and day-of-month as local_date_time unless original day was the last day of month. see date_time::years_duration for more details

Subtracts a years object and a local_date_time. Result will be same month and day-of-month as local_date_time unless original day was the last day of month. see date_time::years_duration for more details

Subtracts a years object from a local_date_time. Result will be same month and day-of-month as local_date_time unless original day was the last day of month. see date_time::years_duration for more details

typedef.name: dst_calc_rule
typedef.purpose: Provides rule of the form starting Apr 30 ending Oct 21.

typedef.name: partial_date_dst_rule
typedef.purpose: Provides rule of the form first Sunday in April, last Saturday in Oct.

typedef.name: first_last_dst_rule
typedef.purpose: Provides rule of the form first Sunday in April, last Saturday in Oct.

typedef.name: last_last_dst_rule
typedef.purpose: Provides rule of the form last Sunday in April, last Saturday in Oct.

typedef.name: nth_last_dst_rule
typedef.purpose: Provides rule in form of [1st|2nd|3rd|4th] Sunday in April, last Sunday in Oct.

typedef.name: nth_kday_dst_rule
typedef.purpose: Provides rule in form of [1st|2nd|3rd|4th] Sunday in April/October.

typedef.name: nth_day_of_the_week_in_month_dst_rule
typedef.purpose: Provides rule in form of [1st|2nd|3rd|4th] Sunday in April/October.

struct.name: ambiguous_result
struct.purpose: simple exception for reporting when STD or DST cannot be determined

class.name: local_date_time_base
class.purpose: Representation of "wall-clock" time in a particular time zone.

description.para: Representation of "wall-clock" time in a particular time zone Local_date_time_base holds a time value (date and time offset from 00:00) along with a time zone. The time value is stored as UTC and conversions to wall clock time are made as needed. This approach allows for operations between wall-clock times in different time zones, and daylight savings time considerations, to be made. Time zones are required to be in the form of a boost::shared_ptr<time_zone_base>.
A UTC time
Timezone for to adjust the UTC time to.

This constructor interprets the passed time as a UTC time. So, for example, if the passed timezone is UTC-5 then the time will be adjusted back 5 hours. The time zone allows for automatic calculation of whether the particular time is adjusted for daylight savings, etc. If the time zone shared pointer is null then time stays unadjusted.
This constructs a local time – the passed time information understood to be in the passed tz. The DST flag must be passed to indicate whether the time is in daylight savings or not.

throws.simpara: -- time_label_invalid if the time passed does not exist in the given locale. The non-existent case occurs typically during the shift-back from daylight savings time. When the clock is shifted forward a range of times (2 am to 3 am in the US) is skipped and hence is invalid.
-- dst_not_valid if the DST flag is passed for a period where DST is not active.

description.para: This constructs a local time – the passed time information understood to be in the passed tz. The DST flag is calculated according to the specified rule.

destructor.purpose: Simple destructor, releases time zone if last referrer.

method.name: zone
method.purpose: returns time zone associated with calling instance

method.name: is_dst
method.purpose: returns false is time_zone is NULL and if time value is a special_value

method.name: utc_time
method.purpose: Returns object's time value as a utc representation.

method.name: local_time
method.purpose: Returns object's time value as a local representation.

method.name: to_string
method.purpose: Returns string in the form "2003-Aug-20 05:00:00 EDT".

description.para: Returns string in the form "2003-Aug-20 05:00:00 EDT". If time_zone is NULL the time zone abbreviation will be "UTC". The time zone abbrev will not be included if calling object is a special_value
returns a local_date_time_base in the given time zone with the optional time_duration added.

method.name: zone_name
method.purpose: Returns name of associated time zone or "Coordinated Universal Time".

description.para: Optional bool parameter will return time zone as an offset (ie "+07:00" extended ISO 8601 format). Empty string is returned for classes that do not use a time_zone

method.name: zone_abbrev
method.purpose: Returns abbreviation of associated time zone or "UTC".

description.para: Optional bool parameter will return time zone as an offset (ie "+0700" ISO 8601 format). Empty string is returned for classes that do not use a time_zone

method.name: zone_as_posix_string
method.purpose: returns a posix_time_zone string for the associated time_zone. If no time_zone, "UTC+00" is returned.

method.purpose: local_date_time -= local_date_time --> time_duration_type

method.name: check_dst
method.purpose: Determines if given time label is in daylight savings for given zone.

description.para: Determines if given time label is in daylight savings for given zone. Takes a date and time_duration representing a local time, along with time zone, and returns a time_is_dst_result object as result.

typedef.name: time_zone_ptr
typedef.purpose: Shared Pointer for custom_time_zone and posix_time_zone objects.

struct.name: bad_adjustment
struct.purpose: simple exception for UTC daylight savings adjustment

struct.name: bad_offset
struct.purpose: simple exception for UTC and Daylight savings start/end offsets

class.name: posix_time_zone_base
class.purpose: A time zone class constructed from a POSIX time zone string.

description.para: A POSIX time zone string takes the form of: "std offset dst [offset],start[/time],end[/time]" (w/no spaces) 'std' specifies the abbrev of the time zone. 'offset' is the offset from UTC. 'dst' specifies the abbrev of the time zone during daylight savings time. The second offset is how many hours changed during DST. Default=1 'start' and'end' are the dates when DST goes into (and out of) effect. 'offset' takes the form of: [+|-]hh[:mm[:ss]] {h=0-23, m/s=0-59} 'time' and 'offset' take the same form. Time defaults=02:00:00 'start' and 'end' can be one of three forms: Mm.w.d {month=1-12, week=1-5 (5 is always last), day=0-6} Jn {n=1-365 Feb29 is never counted} n {n=0-365 Feb29 is counted in leap years} Example "PST-5PDT01:00:00,M4.1.0/02:00:00,M10.1.0/02:00:00" Exceptions will be thrown under these conditions: An invalid date spec (see date class) A boost::local_time::bad_offset exception will be thrown for: A DST start or end offset that is negative or more than 24 hours A UTC zone that is greater than +14 or less than -12 hours A boost::local_time::bad_adjustment exception will be thrown for: A DST adjustment that is 24 hours or more (positive or negative)
Note that UTC zone offsets can be greater than +12: http://www.worldtimezone.com/utc/utc+1200.html

constructor.purpose: Construct from a POSIX time zone string.

method.name: std_zone_abbrev
method.purpose: String for the zone when not in daylight savings (eg: EST)

method.name: dst_zone_abbrev
method.purpose: String for the timezone when in daylight savings (eg: EDT)

description.para: For those time zones that have no DST, an empty string is used

method.name: std_zone_name
method.purpose: String for the zone when not in daylight savings (eg: Eastern Standard Time)

description.para: The full STD name is not extracted from the posix time zone string. Therefore, the STD abbreviation is used in it's place

method.name: dst_zone_name
method.purpose: String for the timezone when in daylight savings (eg: Eastern Daylight Time)

description.para: The full DST name is not extracted from the posix time zone string. Therefore, the STD abbreviation is used in it's place. For time zones that have no DST, an empty string is used

method.name: has_dst
method.purpose: True if zone uses daylight savings adjustments otherwise false.

method.name: dst_local_start_time
method.purpose: Local time that DST starts – NADT if has_dst is false.

method.name: dst_local_end_time
method.purpose: Local time that DST ends – NADT if has_dst is false.

method.name: base_utc_offset
method.purpose: Base offset from UTC for zone (eg: -07:30:00)

method.name: dst_offset
method.purpose: Adjustment forward or back made while DST is in effect.

method.name: to_posix_string
method.purpose: Returns a POSIX time_zone string for this object.

description.para: Extract time zone abbreviations for STD & DST as well as the offsets for the time shift that occurs and how much of a shift. At this time full time zone names are NOT extracted so the abbreviations are used in their place

method.name: julian_no_leap
method.purpose: Julian day. Feb29 is never counted, even in leap years.

method.name: julian_day
method.purpose: Julian day. Feb29 is always counted, but exception thrown in non-leap years.

method.name: td_as_string
method.purpose: helper function used when throwing exceptions

description.para: Object populated with boost::shared_ptr<time_zone_base> objects Database is populated from specs stored in external csv file. See date_time::tz_db_base for greater detail
